bug.summary: Cannot assign node features after removing edges
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Assigning node features using "g.ndata['h']=xxx" will report bugs <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
import dgl import torch g = dgl.DGLGraph() g.add_nodes(5) g.add_edges([0,2,3,1,1],[1,0,3,1,0],data={'h':torch.ones(5,3)}) g.remove_edges([0,1]) g.ndata['feats'] = torch.ones([5,6]) Report bugs: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/zkgntmp01/DyGNN/DGNN/test/node_feats_dgl.py", line 19, in <module> g.ndata['feats'] = torch.ones([5,6]) File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/view.py", line 65, in __setitem__ self._graph.set_n_repr({key : val}, self._nodes) File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/graph.py", line 1794, in set_n_repr self._node_frame[key] = val File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/frame.py", line 671, in __setitem__ self.update_data(key, val, inplace=False) File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/frame.py", line 698, in update_data self.update_column(key, val, inplace=inplace) File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/frame.py", line 729, in update_column self._frame[name] = data File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/frame.py", line 328, in __setitem__ self.update_column(name, data) File "/home/zkgntmp01/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/frame.py", line 415, in update_column (self.num_rows, len(col))) dgl._ffi.base.DGLError: Expected data to have 0 rows, got 5. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
output a Tensor with size [5.6] <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
DGL Version (0.5a): Backend Library & Version (Pytorch 1.3.0): OS (Linux): How you installed DGL (pip): Python version: 3.7.0 CUDA/cuDNN version 10.1

comments.comment: Just a note. Calling g.ndata['feats'] = torch.ones([5,6]) the second time works. Should fix this.
Thanks for reporting this bug, will fix it soon.
Bug fixed, please try the master branch or dgl nightly build version and see if the problem persists.
